snippet.title: shell and GNU make debuggers
snippet.description: We have debuggers for bash, zsh, ksh, GNU make 3.81 and Python. In the patched sources for Make, we provide better error handling and tracing. GNU Emacs support is included for all debuggers.

snippet.title: GNU Make Standard Library
snippet.description: GNU Make Standard Library: a library of functions written for GNU Make using GNU Make's built in functions.

snippet.title: Rolemaster Office
snippet.description: PC and NPC character generator for Rolemaster RMFRP roleplaying system (from Iron Crown Enterprises). The program calculates all bonus and generates a nice PDF character sheet that contains additionally pages. The programm does not provide during-game support.

snippet.title: SM Character Generator
snippet.description: A Space Master 2nd Edition Character Generator

snippet.title: SCons - a Software Construction tool
snippet.description: SCons is a software construction tool (build tool, substitute for Make) implemented in Python, based on the winning design in the Software Carpentry build tool competition (in turn based on the Cons build tool).

snippet.title: Wineskin
snippet.description: Turn Windows programs and games into Mac OS X apps.

snippet.title: ERMaster
snippet.description: ERMaster is Eclipse plug-in to make ER diagram. Functionally, Import from data base, Making of table definition book on Excel, Image output, DDL output, etc. are being offered.

snippet.title: TeXstudio - A LaTeX Editor
snippet.description: TeXstudio is a fully featured LaTeX editor. Our goal is to make writing LaTeX documents as easy and comfortable as possible. Some of the outstanding features of TeXstudio are an integrated pdf viewer with (almost) word-level synchronization, live inline preview, advanced syntax-highlighting, live checking of references, citations, latex commands, spelling and grammar. Find out more at our website.

snippet.title: Harbour
snippet.description: Harbour is the free software implementation of a multi-platform, multi-threading, object-oriented, scriptable programming language, backward compatible with Clipper/xBase. Harbour consists of a compiler and runtime libraries with multiple UI and database backends, its own make system and a large collection of libraries and interfaces to many popular APIs.
